item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo shrugs off training injury setback
item.description: Brace yourself if you're a Real Madrid fan or supporter of the Portuguese national team.
item.ExtractedText: 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Barcelona's players celebrate a 24th La Liga title after a 3-0 win at Granada. Hide Caption 1 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Real Madrid's defenders Sergio Ramos and Pepe applaud their fans at the end of the 2-0 win at Deportiva La Coruna, but their side had to settle for second place in La Liga. Hide Caption 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Real Madrid's Cristiano Ronaldo is, congratulated by Pepe after scoring the first goal at Deportivo. Hide Caption 3 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Suarez celebrates his crucial opener for Barcelona in the win at Granada which kept it a point clear of Real. Hide Caption 4 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Ronaldo is all smiles after scoring his second goal before halftime at Deportivo. He did not appear after the break. Hide Caption 5 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Suarez matched Ronaldo with his second just before the break at Granada to leave his side with a two-goal cushion. Hide Caption 6 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Deportivo's Sidney fights for the ball with Real Madrid's Gareth Bale, who was substituted before the end of the match with the Champions League final still to come for his side. Hide Caption 7 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Suarez vies with Granada's Brazilian defender Matheus Doria, proving a handful for the home team throughout the vital match. Hide Caption 8 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Barcelona's Neymar has played a key role for the Catalans this season and set up Suarez for his hat-trick near the end. Hide Caption 9 of 10 10 photos: How Barca won La Liga title Suarez embraces Neymar after completing his hat-trick at Granada and his 40th league goal of the season. Hide Caption
